alert.note: Alert for Garden; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 8:46PM CDT until September 20 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nebraska... North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Garden and Keith Counties. For the North Platte River...Lewellen for elevated river levels. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall with increased runoff is expected. * WHERE...North Platte River at Lewellen. * WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Overflow and high water table levels may cause seepage and flooding of basements and crawl spaces near and along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.2 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 745 AM MDT.Friday afternoon at 1215 PM MDT.
